metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9461 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
smbd in Samba before 4.4.10 and 4.5.x before 4.5.6 has a denial of service vulnerability (fd_open_atomic infinite loop with high CPU usage and memory consumption) due to wrongly handling dangling symlinks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9461` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> precise/esm hasn't the code affect.

criterions.comment: samba package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.9').
